intro: Spiesia mixotriche, commonly known as the mixed-haired spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine, branched hairs. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in a cup-like structure called a cyathium. Spiesia mixotriche is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
